topic: A client is complaining about an app feature

messages.text: Hey team, we have a client complaining about the new feature we rolled out last week. They're saying it's not user-friendly and is causing frustration for their employees.
What's the feature they're specifically complaining about? Is it the login process or the dashboard layout?
I think it's the new workflow approval system. I've been going through the feedback emails and a few clients have mentioned it's not intuitive.
I agree with Sarah. I've been testing it myself and I can see how it might be confusing. Maybe we should revisit the design and make some changes?
But didn't we user-test this feature before launch? What did our test users say about it?
We did user-test it, but I think we might have missed some key pain points. And to be honest, our test users were mostly internal employees, so they might have been biased towards our own workflow.
That's a good point, Josh. We should probably do some more user testing with external users to get a better understanding of the issues.
And in the meantime, can we provide some kind of workaround or temporary solution for the client? They're getting pretty frustrated.
I can work on putting together a guide or tutorial to help them navigate the new system. Would that help?
That's a great idea, Emily. And maybe we can also offer some additional support or training to help them get up to speed.
Okay, let's prioritize the guide and support for now, and then revisit the design and user testing once we've addressed the immediate concerns.
Agreed. And let's also make sure to communicate clearly with the client about what we're doing to address their concerns. Transparency is key here.
I'll work on drafting a response to the client, and Emily can work on the guide. Tom, can you look into setting up some additional support or training?
Sounds good. And Josh, can you keep an eye on the client's account and make sure they're not experiencing any other issues?
Will do. Let's keep each other updated on our progress and make sure we're all on the same page.
